comment: BiDi driver doesn't support custom WebSocket factories

comment: Firefox BiDi doesn't support network.getData with DataType.Request - only DataType.Response is supported
testIdPattern: [Puppeteer-Sharp] network Request.postData should work plain text

comment: Firefox BiDi doesn't support network.getData with DataType.Request - only DataType.Response is supported
testIdPattern: [Puppeteer-Sharp] network Request.postData should work with low surrogate

comment: Firefox BiDi: cookies + reload + request interception combination fails - events not received during reload when cookies are set. Works in upstream TypeScript but not in .NET.
testIdPattern: [requestinterception.spec] request interception Page.setRequestInterception should properly return navigation response when URL has cookies

comment: Firefox BiDi: cookies + reload + request interception combination fails - events not received during reload when cookies are set. Works in upstream TypeScript but not in .NET.
testIdPattern: [requestinterception-experimental.spec] cooperative request interception Page.setRequestInterception should properly return navigation response when URL has cookies

comment: BiDi does not support Tagged/Accessible PDF - upstream has FAIL/PASS but we skip since it always fails
testIdPattern: [pdf.spec] Page.pdf can print to PDF with accessible

comment: Firefox BiDi: connection issues when reconnecting to browser - fails with 'Failed to create connection'
testIdPattern: [browser.spec] Browser.isConnected should set the browser connected state

comment: Firefox BiDi: connection issues when connecting to remote browser - fails with 'Failed to create connection'
testIdPattern: [browser.spec] Browser.process should not return child_process for remote browser

comment: Firefox BiDi: RequestServedFromCache event not properly tracked
testIdPattern: [network.spec] network Network Events Page.Events.RequestServedFromCache

testIdPattern: [requestinterception-experimental.spec] cooperative request interception Page.setRequestInterception should cooperatively * by priority
